transcript.text: yo hey there guys Jordan here I just
want to take a minute and discuss with
you why you need to set yourself up with
a VPN or a virtual private network
simply put a VPN creates a virtual
encrypted tunnel between you and a
remote server operated by the VPN
service all external Internet traffic is
routed through this tunnel so your data
is secure from prying eyes and best of
all your computer will have the IP
address of the VPN server masking your
identity and then when your data reaches
that VPN server it exits onto the public
Internet so a VPN service is crucial to
protect you and your data from anybody
accessing it to understand the value of
a VPN let's look at some specific
scenarios where you might be able to use
one consider public Wi-Fi networks such
as coffee shops or airports normally you
would connect to it without a second
thought but do you really know who might
be watching the traffic on that network
can you even be sure that that Wi-Fi
network is operated by who it says it is
I mean it might say Starbucks Wi-Fi but
it might not actually be Starbucks Wi-Fi
so you can't really even be sure that
public Wi-Fi networks are legit and just
think about the passwords banking
information credit card numbers and
whatever other private information that
you send every time you go online and if
you connect to that same public Wi-Fi
network with a VPN then you're gonna be
safe and secure and you can be rest
assured that nobody on that network is
going to be able to intercept your data
another example showing the value of
VPNs is blocked websites and using the
services to be able to access these some
governments have decided that it's in
the public's best interest to block
access to certain websites for all of
their population but if you use a VPN
you can actually have your web traffic
tunneled to a different country with
more progressive policies you can
actually access that website and again
because VPNs encrypt your data it'll
still protect you even though you're
doing that and then lastly we have the
topics of three-letter agencies Facebook
Google and all these huge corporations
that are all looking for your data of
course Facebook has been in the news
lately using your data for various
reasons given
all of the mass surveillance going on
and all of this selling of all of our
personal information by these huge
social media companies VPNs will help
you to stay anonymous stay safe
and prevent your information getting out
to people that you don't want it to be
with so with all that being said if you
want to start yourself up with a VPN
service I have some good news for you
Virtua Shield is a great VPN service and
there's a few reasons why I love to use
them
the first reason why I like to use
Virtual Shield is because they don't
keep logs so that means a virtual shield
ever gets bought out or hacked they
don't have any logs of their users web
traffic so you'll still be safe another
reason why I like virtual shield is
because they're based in America VPN
companies that are based offshore can
still legally sell your data and since
virtual shield is based in America not
only is your money going into American
hands but your data still cannot be sold
and lastly virtual shield is very cheap
it's very easy to use not only can you
protect your desktops and your laptops
but they have a mobile app where you can
protect your mobile devices as well so
there you go guys set yourself up with a
VPN to protect yourself
I suggest virtual shield there's gonna

your data on the Internet take care
